table.name: mem
table.column:
When applied to weapons systems, this is used for locking on a target. See {'uch:v:2}.
When the object of this verb is {'olQan:n}, it can often be translated "occupy" or "take up".[2]

table.name: mem
table.column: This is an application of {'uch:v:1} to a weapons systems context.

table.name: mem
table.column: include, consist of, be composed of
incluir, consistir em, ser composto de
This is used for talking about chemistry.
Dies wird verwendet, um über Chemie zu sprechen. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
این برای صحبت در مورد شیمی استفاده می شود. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Detta används för att prata om kemi. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Это используется для разговоров о химии. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Isso é usado para falar sobre química. [AUTOTRANSLATED]

table.name: mem
table.column:
The word {'uD'a':n:nolink} appears in {HQ 1.3, Sept. 1992:src}, where it is also defined as just "laser".
Shintaro Uda was a co-inventor of the beam antenna.

table.name: mem
table.column: This is a little squirmy thing that somehows turns into a {Su'wan ghew:n}. It is not used to make {qagh:n}.

table.name: mem
table.column: have a hangover, be hung over
ter uma ressaca, estar de ressaca

table.name: mem
table.column: uj (واحد اندازه گیری خطی، 34.83 سانتی متر) [AUTOTRANSLATED]

Based on the measurements given on the {BoP:src} poster, one {'uj:n:nolink} is very close to 34.83 cm.
Three {'uj:n:nolink} is about 3'5", five {'uj:n:nolink} is about 5'8", and six {'uj:n:nolink} is about 6'10".[2]

Basiert auf die Maßangaben auf dem {BoP:src} Poster. Ein {'uj:n:nolink} entspricht ca. 34.83 cm.
Drei {'uj:n:nolink} sind etwa 3 Fuß 5 Zoll, fünf {'uj:n:nolink} sind etwa 5 Fuß 8 Zoll und sechs {'uj:n:nolink} sind etwa 6 Fuß 10 Zoll.[2]
In {KGT:src}, this unit is described as "about 35 cm". Also, Okrand has not been consistent in writing the plural of this in English, using "ujs" in earlier work but switching to "ujes" later.

▶ {jav 'ujmey 'ab SuvwI'.:sen:nolink} "The warrior is six ujs tall." (about 6'10")[2] ▶ {vagh 'ujmey vI'ab.:sen:nolink} "I'm five ujs tall." (about 5'8")[2] ▶ {wej 'ujmey 'ab 'oy'naQ.:sen:nolink} "Painstiks are a little over one meter long."[3] ▶ {wejvatlh loSmaH loS vI' vagh wej 'uj 'aD Duj:sen:nolink} "Length: 120 M"[4] ▶ {loSmaH jav vI' Soch loS 'uj 'ab meH:sen:nolink} "Bridge Height: 16.28 M"[4] ▶ {HIvtaHvIS toQDuj cha'vatlh wejmaH Soch vI' vagh chorgh 'uj 'ab 'oH:sen:nolink} "Attack Formation Height: 82.75 M"[4] ▶ {qughtaHvIS toQDuj HutmaH vI' jav wa' 'uj 'ab 'oH:sen:nolink} "Cruise Formation Height: 31.56 M"[4] ▶ {SaqtaHvIS toQDuj wa'vatlh loS vI' jav chorgh 'uj 'ab 'oH:sen:nolink} "Landing Formation Height: 36.46 M"[4] ▶ {cha' 'ujmo' jIH woch law' SoH woch puS:sen:nolink} "I'm two {'uj:sen:nolink}es taller than you."[5] ▶ {ron SuvwI'; chorgh 'ujmey lID:sen@@ron:v:1, SuvwI':n, chorgh:n:1, 'uj:n, -mey:n, lID:v} or {chorgh 'ujmey lID SuvwI'; ron:sen@@chorgh:n:1, 'uj:n, -mey:n, lID:v, SuvwI':n, ron:v:1} "the warrior rolled (haphazardly) for eight ujes"[6] ▶ {rav cha' 'uj(mey) 'aqroS loS 'uj(mey) 'ab:sen@@rav ...:sen, cha':n:num, 'uj:n, -mey:n, 'aqroS ...:sen, loS:n:1,num, 'uj:n, -mey:n, 'ab:v} "has a length between two and four ujes" (it's at least two ujes and no more than four)[7]

[1] {KGT:src}, [2] {msn 1997.10.22:src}, [3] {SkyBox 32:src} (reprinted in {HQ 6.2, p.9, Jun. 1997:src}), [4] {BoP:src}, [5] {Saarbrücken qepHom'a' 2015:src}, [6] {KLI mailing list 2019.03.01:src}, [7] {qep'a' 26 (2019):src}

table.name: mem
table.column: One {'uj'a':n:nolink} is equal to nine {'uj:n:nolink}. However, there is no unit {'ujHom:n:nolink} denoting one-ninth of an {'uj:n:nolink}.[1]
Ein {'uj'a':n:nolink} entspricht neun {'uj:n:nolink}. Es gibt aber keine Einheit wie {'ujHom:n:nolink} die ein Neuntel eines {'uj:n:nolink} entspräche.[1]

table.name: mem
table.column: He is a member of the House of Mo'Kai ({mo'qay tuq:n:name}).
[1] {DSC - Battle at the Binary Stars:src}, [2] {Saarbrücken qepHom'a' 2019:src}

table.name: mem
table.column: This is a reference to the "Underwriter's Laboratories". A label with the acronym "UL" is found on all electrical appliances in the US.

table.name: mem
table.column: This word appears in {TNK:src} only in the plural as {'ul 'aplo'mey:n:nolink} "batteries". Technically, what is commonly called a "battery" is a single cell, and a "battery" is an array ({DaH:n}) of such cells.

table.name: mem
table.column: This word is not actually defined in the {paq'batlh:src}, but its derivation and meaning are clear.

table.name: mem
table.column: Topf (allg. Begriff für Kochtopf, auch wenn Hitze nicht involviert ist)

table.name: mem
table.column: تکان دادن چوب، مخلوط کردن چوب [AUTOTRANSLATED]
палочка для перемешивания, палочка для перемешивания [AUTOTRANSLATED]

table.name: mem
table.column: Dies ist {quD:n} das mit Chemikalien hergestellt wird.

table.name: mem
table.column: This is a weaved container for carrying things.
Dies ist ein gewebter Behälter zum Tragen von Dingen. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
این ظرف بافی برای حمل وسایل است. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Detta är en vävd behållare för att bära saker. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Это сотканный контейнер для переноски вещей. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
這是用於搬運物品的編織容器。 [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Este é um recipiente trançado para transportar coisas. [AUTOTRANSLATED]

table.name: mem
table.column: be unsavory, disgusting, repugnant, loathsome, icky
ناراحت کننده، نفرت انگیز، نفرت انگیز، بی رحمانه، لعنتی [AUTOTRANSLATED]
vara smaklös, vara äcklig, vara frånstötande, vara avskyvärd,
быть неприятным, отвратительным, отвратительным, отвратительным, непристойным [AUTOTRANSLATED]
是令人討厭的、令人作嘔的、令人厭惡的、令人厭惡的、icky的 [AUTOTRANSLATED]
There is an idiom, {'up; yIH rur@@'up:v, yIH:n, rur:v}.

table.name: mem
table.column: If there's an object, it's the thing being whistled.
Wenn es ein Objekt gibt, wird es gepfiffen. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
اگر یک شی وجود داشته باشد ، این مورد سوت زدن است. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Om det finns ett objekt är det saken som visslas. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Если есть объект, это вещь, которую насвистывают. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
如果有物體，那就是被吹口哨的東西。 [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Se existe um objeto, é a coisa que está sendo assobiada. [AUTOTRANSLATED]

table.name: mem
table.column: This is just a regular noun-noun construction. It was used as an example in a message on the {msn:src} newsgroup to show that the known vocabulary and existing grammar can be used to say a lot of things which aren't explicitly spelled out.

table.name: mem
table.column: This is missing from the K-E side of {TKDA:src}.

table.name: mem
table.column: This is a person who commits treason. For a person who betrays someone, see {maghwI':n}.
Das ist jemand, der einen (Hoch)Verrat begeht. Für jemanden, deinen einen anderen verrät, siehe {maghwI':n}.
This is missing from the K-E side of {TKDA:src}.

table.name: mem
table.column: Maltz referred to the Federation card game "Poker" as {'urghwI':n:nolink}, although other Klingons would probably not understand this.[1]

table.name: mem
table.column: پا (از بالای زانو تا مچ پا)

table.name: mem
table.column: en slags fågel (för oljud i gryningen, vildsintare än en tupp)
This is a noisy bird known to make a ruckus at dawn, which has been likened to a rooster (but is much fiercer than a rooster).
Das ist ein lauter Vogel der morgens wie ein Hahn kräht, aber viel lauter.
این یک پرنده پر سر و صدا است که در هنگام طلوع آفتاب ساخته شده است ، که به یک خروس تشبیه شده است (اما بسیار خروس تر از خروس است). [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Detta är en bullrig fågel som är känd för att göra en ruckus i gryningen, som har jämförts med en tupp (men är mycket hårdare än en tupp). [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Это шумная птица, которая, как известно, совершает шум на рассвете, которую сравнивают с петухом (но гораздо жестче, чем петух). [AUTOTRANSLATED]
這是一種吵鬧的鳥，已知會在黎明時引起騷動，已被比喻為公雞（但比公雞兇猛得多）。 [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Este é um pássaro barulhento, conhecido por fazer um tumulto ao amanhecer, que foi comparado a um galo (mas é muito mais feroz do que um galo). [AUTOTRANSLATED]
The "leghorn" is a type of chicken, and Foghorn Leghorn is a cartoon leghorn rooster.

table.name: mem
table.column: The USS Constitution had the nickname "Old Ironsides".

table.name: mem
table.column: {'uSu':n:nolink} is native to the original inhabitants of the planet Tanganika.[2]

One type of lighter soy sauce is called "usukuchi shoyu" (薄口醤油) in Japanese. Also, the "yuzu" plant is used in the creation of some sauces in Asian cuisine. However, if this word is a pun, it wasn't due to Okrand, but the writers of {DS9 - Melora:src}.

table.name: mem
table.column: This word does not appear in canon. This entry is here for ease of reference only.

table.name: mem
table.column: This refers to a chest of drawers regardless of whether or not there are actually drawers in it at the moment.
Dies bezieht sich auf eine Kommode, unabhängig davon, ob sich derzeit tatsächlich Schubladen darin befinden oder nicht. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
این موضوع به قفسه سینه بستگی دارد بدون توجه به اینکه در حال حاضر واقعاً کشوهایی در آن وجود دارد یا خیر. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Detta avser en byrå oavsett om det faktiskt finns lådor i det för tillfället. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Это относится к комоду, независимо от того, есть ли на самом деле в нем ящики в данный момент. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
這是指一個抽屜櫃，而不管當前是否有抽屜。 [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Refere-se a uma cômoda, independentemente de haver ou não gavetas no momento. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
"Drawer" is slang for "underwear", and Under Armour (UA) is a brand of casual and sports clothing.

table.name: mem
table.column: An officer who ended service in retirement.
Ein Offizier, der seinen Dienst im Ruhestand beendete. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
مأموری که در دوران بازنشستگی به خدمت خود پایان داد. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
En tjänsteman som avslutade tjänsten i pension. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Офицер, который закончил службу в отставке. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Um oficial que terminou o serviço na aposentadoria. [AUTOTRANSLATED]

table.name: mem
table.column: This verb is used for clicking on a computer mouse button (even though the action is actually to press down and then release). For clicking on a hyperlink, the verb {wIv:v} is used rather than {'uy:v:nolink}.[2]

table.name: mem
table.column: For tens of millions, one could combine {maH:n:2} with {'uy':n:nolink} or {vatlh:n} with {bIp:n}.[2]

table.name: mem
table.column: This is also the name of an opera, which narrates many of the same events as found in the {paq'batlh:n}.
Dies ist auch der Name einer Oper, welche einen Großteil der Geschichte des {paq'batlh:n} erzählt.

table.name: mem
table.column:
A "Doppelgänger" is the double of a person from the mirror universe.
At {qep'a' 26 (2019):src}, the note expanding {Dop:v:1} to {Dop:v:2} alludes to {'u' Dop:n:nolink} being based on the "opposite" meaning.
